metadata.description: Structured dataset of congenital and acquired savant cases used in the FNC-savant framework.

cases.primary_ability: spontaneous perception and reproduction of geometric fractals
cases.lesion_location: suspected right parietal/occipital disruptions; altered connectivity
cases.cognitive_profile_summary: average premorbid functioning, no prior interest in mathematics; post-injury emergence of highly systematized geometric visualization.
phenomenology_quotes: I see geometric shapes and fractals in everything.
It's as if the world is made of grids and patterns.
key_sources: Fagan, A. (2024). The mystery of sudden genius. Psychology Today.
Padgett & Seabrook (2014). Struck by Genius. Houghton Mifflin Harcourt.
cases.fnc_relevance_notes: Clear instance of sudden access to highly structured mathematical/spatial patterns with no learning curve; maps to Field-geometry access with Node retuning after trauma.

cases.primary_ability: complex piano composition and performance without prior training
cases.hemisphere_dominance: left hemisphere disruption with enhanced right hemisphere function
cases.cognitive_profile_summary: No musical training prior to injury; immediate emergence of complex compositional and performance abilities post-injury.
phenomenology_quotes: I could suddenly see music as patterns and shapes.
The piano keys seemed to light up and tell me what to play.
key_sources: Fitzgerald, S. (2021). Studying acquired savant syndrome. Brain & Life.
Treffert, D. A. (2014). Savant syndrome: Realities, myths and misconceptions. JADD.
cases.fnc_relevance_notes: Instant emergence of musical pattern access; supports pre-existing Field-harmonic structures accessed via altered Node filtering.

cases.primary_ability: calendar calculation and perfect weather recall for any date after injury
cases.cognitive_profile_summary: Typical development prior to injury; sudden emergence of calendar calculation and autobiographical memory for weather post-injury.
phenomenology_quotes: I just know what day it was.
I can see the weather in my mind for any day since the accident.
key_sources: Treffert, D. A. (2009). The savant syndrome. Phil Trans R Soc B.
cases.fnc_relevance_notes: Temporal Field access without learning period; supports Node retuning to calendar structure patterns.

cases.primary_ability: extraordinary rote memory and calendar calculation across multiple centuries
cases.neurological_event: agenesis/dysgenesis of corpus callosum, cerebellar abnormalities
cases.autism_diagnosis: not classically autistic but with overlapping traits
cases.cognitive_profile_summary: Impaired abstraction and social cognition but vast, stable, cross-domain factual and temporal memory.
phenomenology_quotes: He could open a book, read two pages at once – one with each eye – and remember almost everything he read.
He could tell you the day of the week for any date with no apparent calculation.
key_sources: Treffert, D. A. (2014). Savant syndrome: Realities, myths and misconceptions. JADD.
cases.fnc_relevance_notes: Exemplifies extreme domain-specific access to temporal and factual invariants; consistent with stable Field structures accessed via atypical Node architecture with reduced integration.

cases.primary_ability: immediate reproduction of complex piano pieces after single hearing
cases.autism_diagnosis: developmental disability with savant musical skill
cases.cognitive_profile_summary: Severe developmental disabilities with extraordinary musical reproduction ability.
phenomenology_quotes: Played complex Tchaikovsky piano concerto perfectly after hearing it once on television.
key_sources: Treffert, D. A. (2009). The savant syndrome. Phil Trans R Soc B.
cases.fnc_relevance_notes: Direct access to harmonic structure; minimal learning; strong fit with Field-harmonic access via Node specialization.
